Aux:TextAnnotations.Aux:document_text: AMENDMENT NO. 7 TO AGREEMENT BETWEEN TENNESSEE STATE UNIVERSITY AND SSC SERVICE SOLUTIONS THIS AMENDMENT NO. 7, by and between TENNESSEE STATE UNIVERSITY, a Tennessee Board of Regents System institution, located at 3500 John A. Merritt Boulevard, Nashville, Tennessee 37209-1561, hereinafter referred to as "TSU" or "UNIVERSITY" and SSC SERVICE SOLUTIONS, having its principle place of business at 1845 Midpark Road, Knoxville, Tennessee 37921, hereinafter referred to as "CONTRACTOR". WITNESSETH WHEREAS, the parties desire to modify the terms and conditions, and to add or delete certain other terms and conditions to the original Agreement (No. 332.77-03-837), which took effect July 1, 2003 (to provide custodial services for academic and administrative buildings, and other designated areas), and in accordance to the provisions set herein, including any previous attachments, addenda and/or amendments which are hereby made a part of the original Agreement to the same extent as if copied herein at length, the parties hereby agree as set forth below: Attachment I, is amended by the addition of the following building: Building Sq. Ft. Research & Sponsored Programs Bldg 35,000 sq. ft. Note: Total square footage for all buildings included under this Agreement should now read: 1,516,877 sq. ft. Contractor is granted a 3.5% price increase effective July 1, 2007. Section B, is modified to read: The University agrees to compensate the Contractor as follows: 1. Rate of Compensation : $1,075,336.56 2. Timetable for Payment: Monthly a. $89,611.38 per month upon completion of work and submission of invoice b. $8.95 per hour for extra services. (Only when required and authorized by the Director of Facilities Management and invoiced separately.) c. Window and blind cleaning services may be requested as a special project in which cost will be mutually agreed upon by the Director of Facilities Management. 3. Payments to the Contractor shall be made according to the schedule set out above, but only after receipt of an invoice for services satisfactorily performed for the month in which invoiced. The final payment shall be made only after the Contractor has completely performed his duties under this Agreement. 4. In no event shall the liability of the University under this Agreement exceed the amount of $1,075,336.56 including any additional authorized changes which would increase or decrease the amount by a duly authorized Purchase Order Change. Section D, is modified by the addition of the following: 1. Prohibition on Hiring Illegal Immigrants. Tennessee Public Chapter No. 878 of 2006, TCA §12-4-124, requires that Contactor attest in writing that Contractor will not knowingly utilize the services of illegal immigrants in the performance of this Contract and will not knowingly utilize the services of any subcontractor, if permitted under this Contract, who will utilize the services of illegal immigrants in the performance of this Contract. The attestation shall be made on the form, Attestation re: Personnel Used in Contract Performance ("the Attestation"), which is attached and hereby incorporated by this reference. 2. If Contractor is discovered to have breached the Attestation, the Commissioner of Finance and Administration shall declare that the Contractor shall be prohibited from contracting or submitting a bid to any Tennessee Board of Regents institution or any other state entity for a period of one (1) year from the date of discovery of the breach. Contractor may appeal the one (1) year by utilizing an appeals process in the Rules of Finance and Administration, Chapter 0620. This Amendment shall constitute an exercise of the fourth (4th) year and final renewal option of the original Agreement, and shall operate to extend the Agreement term from July 1, 2007 to June 30, 2008. All previous executed Amendments to the original Agreement remain in effect unless otherwise stated herein. Subject to the modifications set forth in this Amendment, all other terms and conditions in the original Agreement remain the same unless modified by written Amendment and properly executed by all parties and approved by the President or, when required, by the Chancellor, Tennessee Board of Regents or his designee. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have by their duly authorized representative set forth their signatures: Date TENNESSEE STATE UNIVERSITY Melvin N. Johnsor^/ / President Date TENNESSEE BOARD OF REGENTS I//. By: Charles W. Manning Chancellor (o -6^ Date
